speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: M, O, A, I, doth sway my life.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: A fustian riddle!

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Excellent wench, say I.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'M, O, A, I, doth sway my life.' Nay, but first, let

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: me see, let me see, let me see.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: What dish o' poison has she dressed him!

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: And with what wing the staniel cheques at it!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'I may command where I adore.' Why, she may command

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: me: I serve her; she is my lady. Why, this is

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: evident to any formal capacity; there is no

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: obstruction in this: and the end,--what should

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: that alphabetical position portend? If I could make

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: that resemble something in me,--Softly! M, O, A,

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: O, ay, make up that: he is now at a cold scent.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Sowter will cry upon't for all this, though it be as

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: rank as a fox.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: M,--Malvolio; M,--why, that begins my name.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Did not I say he would work it out? the cur is

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: excellent at faults.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: M,--but then there is no consonancy in the sequel;

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: that suffers under probation A should follow but O does.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: And O shall end, I hope.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Ay, or I'll cudgel him, and make him cry O!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: And then I comes behind.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Ay, an you had any eye behind you, you might see

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: more detraction at your heels than fortunes before

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: you.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: M, O, A, I; this simulation is not as the former: and

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: yet, to crush this a little, it would bow to me, for

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: every one of these letters are in my name. Soft!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: here follows prose.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Reads

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'If this fall into thy hand, revolve. In my stars I

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: am above thee; but be not afraid of greatness: some

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: are born great, some achieve greatness, and some

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: have greatness thrust upon 'em. Thy Fates open

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: their hands; let thy blood and spirit embrace them;

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: and, to inure thyself to what thou art like to be,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: cast thy humble slough and appear fresh. Be

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: opposite with a kinsman, surly with servants; let

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: thy tongue tang arguments of state; put thyself into

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: the trick of singularity: she thus advises thee

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: that sighs for thee. Remember who commended thy

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: yellow stockings, and wished to see thee ever

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: cross-gartered: I say, remember. Go to, thou art

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: made, if thou desirest to be so; if not, let me see

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: thee a steward still, the fellow of servants, and

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: not worthy to touch Fortune's fingers. Farewell.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: She that would alter services with thee,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: THE FORTUNATE-UNHAPPY.'

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Daylight and champaign discovers not more: this is

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: open. I will be proud, I will read politic authors,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: I will baffle Sir Toby, I will wash off gross

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: acquaintance, I will be point-devise the very man.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: I do not now fool myself, to let imagination jade

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: me; for every reason excites to this, that my lady

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: loves me. She did commend my yellow stockings of

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: late, she did praise my leg being cross-gartered;

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: and in this she manifests herself to my love, and

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: with a kind of injunction drives me to these habits

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: of her liking. I thank my stars I am happy. I will

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: be strange, stout, in yellow stockings, and

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: cross-gartered, even with the swiftness of putting

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: on. Jove and my stars be praised! Here is yet a

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: postscript.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Reads

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'Thou canst not choose but know who I am. If thou

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: entertainest my love, let it appear in thy smiling;

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: thy smiles become thee well; therefore in my

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: presence still smile, dear my sweet, I prithee.'

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Jove, I thank thee: I will smile; I will do

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: everything that thou wilt have me.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: I will not give my part of this sport for a pension

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: of thousands to be paid from the Sophy.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: I could marry this wench for this device.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: So could I too.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: And ask no other dowry with her but such another jest.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Nor I neither.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Here comes my noble gull-catcher.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Re-enter MARIA

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Wilt thou set thy foot o' my neck?

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Or o' mine either?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Shall I play my freedom at traytrip, and become thy

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: bond-slave?

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: I' faith, or I either?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Why, thou hast put him in such a dream, that when

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: the image of it leaves him he must run mad.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Nay, but say true; does it work upon him?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Like aqua-vitae with a midwife.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: If you will then see the fruits of the sport, mark

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: his first approach before my lady: he will come to

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: her in yellow stockings, and 'tis a colour she

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: abhors, and cross-gartered, a fashion she detests;

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: and he will smile upon her, which will now be so

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: unsuitable to her disposition, being addicted to a

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: melancholy as she is, that it cannot but turn him

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: into a notable contempt. If you will see it, follow

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: me.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: To the gates of Tartar, thou most excellent devil of wit!

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: I'll make one too.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: SCENE I. OLIVIA's garden.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Enter VIOLA, and Clown with a tabour

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Save thee, friend, and thy music: dost thou live by

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: thy tabour?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: No, sir, I live by the church.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Art thou a churchman?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: No such matter, sir: I do live by the church; for

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I do live at my house, and my house doth stand by

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the church.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: So thou mayst say, the king lies by a beggar, if a

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: beggar dwell near him; or, the church stands by thy

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: tabour, if thy tabour stand by the church.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: You have said, sir. To see this age! A sentence is

speaker: Clown
text_entry: but a cheveril glove to a good wit: how quickly the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: wrong side may be turned outward!

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Nay, that's certain; they that dally nicely with

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: words may quickly make them wanton.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I would, therefore, my sister had had no name, sir.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Why, man?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Why, sir, her name's a word; and to dally with that

speaker: Clown
text_entry: word might make my sister wanton. But indeed words

speaker: Clown
text_entry: are very rascals since bonds disgraced them.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Thy reason, man?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Troth, sir, I can yield you none without words; and

speaker: Clown
text_entry: words are grown so false, I am loath to prove

speaker: Clown
text_entry: reason with them.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I warrant thou art a merry fellow and carest for nothing.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Not so, sir, I do care for something; but in my

speaker: Clown
text_entry: conscience, sir, I do not care for you: if that be

speaker: Clown
text_entry: to care for nothing, sir, I would it would make you invisible.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Art not thou the Lady Olivia's fool?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: No, indeed, sir; the Lady Olivia has no folly: she

speaker: Clown
text_entry: will keep no fool, sir, till she be married; and

speaker: Clown
text_entry: fools are as like husbands as pilchards are to

speaker: Clown
text_entry: herrings; the husband's the bigger: I am indeed not

speaker: Clown
text_entry: her fool, but her corrupter of words.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I saw thee late at the Count Orsino's.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Foolery, sir, does walk about the orb like the sun,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: it shines every where. I would be sorry, sir, but

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the fool should be as oft with your master as with

speaker: Clown
text_entry: my mistress: I think I saw your wisdom there.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Nay, an thou pass upon me, I'll no more with thee.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Hold, there's expenses for thee.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Now Jove, in his next commodity of hair, send thee a beard!

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: By my troth, I'll tell thee, I am almost sick for

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: one;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Aside

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: though I would not have it grow on my chin. Is thy

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: lady within?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Would not a pair of these have bred, sir?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Yes, being kept together and put to use.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I would play Lord Pandarus of Phrygia, sir, to bring

speaker: Clown
text_entry: a Cressida to this Troilus.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I understand you, sir; 'tis well begged.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: The matter, I hope, is not great, sir, begging but

speaker: Clown
text_entry: a beggar: Cressida was a beggar. My lady is

speaker: Clown
text_entry: within, sir. I will construe to them whence you

speaker: Clown
text_entry: come; who you are and what you would are out of my

speaker: Clown
text_entry: welkin, I might say 'element,' but the word is over-worn.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Exit

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: This fellow is wise enough to play the fool;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And to do that well craves a kind of wit:

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: He must observe their mood on whom he jests,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: The quality of persons, and the time,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And, like the haggard, cheque at every feather

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: That comes before his eye. This is a practise

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: As full of labour as a wise man's art

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: For folly that he wisely shows is fit;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: But wise men, folly-fall'n, quite taint their wit.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Enter SIR TOBY BELCH, and SIR ANDREW

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Save you, gentleman.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And you, sir.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Dieu vous garde, monsieur.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Et vous aussi; votre serviteur.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: I hope, sir, you are; and I am yours.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Will you encounter the house? my niece is desirous

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: you should enter, if your trade be to her.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I am bound to your niece, sir; I mean, she is the

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: list of my voyage.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Taste your legs, sir; put them to motion.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: My legs do better understand me, sir, than I

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: understand what you mean by bidding me taste my legs.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: I mean, to go, sir, to enter.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I will answer you with gait and entrance. But we

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: are prevented.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Enter OLIVIA and MARIA

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Most excellent accomplished lady, the heavens rain

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: odours on you!

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: That youth's a rare courtier: 'Rain odours;' well.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: My matter hath no voice, to your own most pregnant

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: and vouchsafed ear.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: 'Odours,' 'pregnant' and 'vouchsafed:' I'll get 'em

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: all three all ready.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Let the garden door be shut, and leave me to my hearing.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exeunt SIR TOBY BELCH, SIR ANDREW, and MARIA

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Give me your hand, sir.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: My duty, madam, and most humble service.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: What is your name?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Cesario is your servant's name, fair princess.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: My servant, sir! 'Twas never merry world

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Since lowly feigning was call'd compliment:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: You're servant to the Count Orsino, youth.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And he is yours, and his must needs be yours:

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Your servant's servant is your servant, madam.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: For him, I think not on him: for his thoughts,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Would they were blanks, rather than fill'd with me!

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Madam, I come to whet your gentle thoughts

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: On his behalf.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: O, by your leave, I pray you,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I bade you never speak again of him:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: But, would you undertake another suit,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I had rather hear you to solicit that

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Than music from the spheres.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Dear lady,--

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Give me leave, beseech you. I did send,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: After the last enchantment you did here,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: A ring in chase of you: so did I abuse

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Myself, my servant and, I fear me, you:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Under your hard construction must I sit,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: To force that on you, in a shameful cunning,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Which you knew none of yours: what might you think?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Have you not set mine honour at the stake

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: And baited it with all the unmuzzled thoughts

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: That tyrannous heart can think? To one of your receiving

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Enough is shown: a cypress, not a bosom,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Hideth my heart. So, let me hear you speak.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I pity you.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: That's a degree to love.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: No, not a grize; for 'tis a vulgar proof,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: That very oft we pity enemies.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Why, then, methinks 'tis time to smile again.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: O, world, how apt the poor are to be proud!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: If one should be a prey, how much the better

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: To fall before the lion than the wolf!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Clock strikes

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: The clock upbraids me with the waste of time.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Be not afraid, good youth, I will not have you:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: And yet, when wit and youth is come to harvest,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Your were is alike to reap a proper man:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: There lies your way, due west.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Then westward-ho! Grace and good disposition

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Attend your ladyship!

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: You'll nothing, madam, to my lord by me?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Stay:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I prithee, tell me what thou thinkest of me.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: That you do think you are not what you are.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: If I think so, I think the same of you.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Then think you right: I am not what I am.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I would you were as I would have you be!

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Would it be better, madam, than I am?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I wish it might, for now I am your fool.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: O, what a deal of scorn looks beautiful

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: In the contempt and anger of his lip!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: A murderous guilt shows not itself more soon

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Than love that would seem hid: love's night is noon.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Cesario, by the roses of the spring,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: By maidhood, honour, truth and every thing,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I love thee so, that, maugre all thy pride,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Nor wit nor reason can my passion hide.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Do not extort thy reasons from this clause,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: For that I woo, thou therefore hast no cause,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: But rather reason thus with reason fetter,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Love sought is good, but given unsought better.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: By innocence I swear, and by my youth

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I have one heart, one bosom and one truth,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And that no woman has; nor never none

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Shall mistress be of it, save I alone.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And so adieu, good madam: never more

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Will I my master's tears to you deplore.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Yet come again; for thou perhaps mayst move

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: That heart, which now abhors, to like his love.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: SCENE II. OLIVIA's house.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Enter SIR TOBY BELCH, SIR ANDREW, and FABIAN

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: No, faith, I'll not stay a jot longer.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Thy reason, dear venom, give thy reason.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: You must needs yield your reason, Sir Andrew.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Marry, I saw your niece do more favours to the

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: count's serving-man than ever she bestowed upon me;

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: I saw't i' the orchard.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Did she see thee the while, old boy? tell me that.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: As plain as I see you now.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: This was a great argument of love in her toward you.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: 'Slight, will you make an ass o' me?

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: I will prove it legitimate, sir, upon the oaths of

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: judgment and reason.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: And they have been grand-jury-men since before Noah

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: was a sailor.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: She did show favour to the youth in your sight only

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: to exasperate you, to awake your dormouse valour, to

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: put fire in your heart and brimstone in your liver.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: You should then have accosted her; and with some

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: excellent jests, fire-new from the mint, you should

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: have banged the youth into dumbness. This was

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: looked for at your hand, and this was balked: the

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: double gilt of this opportunity you let time wash

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: off, and you are now sailed into the north of my

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: lady's opinion; where you will hang like an icicle

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: on a Dutchman's beard, unless you do redeem it by

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: some laudable attempt either of valour or policy.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: An't be any way, it must be with valour; for policy

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: I hate: I had as lief be a Brownist as a

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: politician.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Why, then, build me thy fortunes upon the basis of

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: valour. Challenge me the count's youth to fight

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: with him; hurt him in eleven places: my niece shall

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: take note of it; and assure thyself, there is no

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: love-broker in the world can more prevail in man's

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: commendation with woman than report of valour.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: There is no way but this, Sir Andrew.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Will either of you bear me a challenge to him?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Go, write it in a martial hand; be curst and brief;

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: it is no matter how witty, so it be eloquent and fun

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: of invention: taunt him with the licence of ink:

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: if thou thou'st him some thrice, it shall not be

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: amiss; and as many lies as will lie in thy sheet of

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: paper, although the sheet were big enough for the

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: bed of Ware in England, set 'em down: go, about it.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Let there be gall enough in thy ink, though thou

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: write with a goose-pen, no matter: about it.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Where shall I find you?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: We'll call thee at the cubiculo: go.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Exit SIR ANDREW

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: This is a dear manikin to you, Sir Toby.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: I have been dear to him, lad, some two thousand

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: strong, or so.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: We shall have a rare letter from him: but you'll

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: not deliver't?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Never trust me, then; and by all means stir on the

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: youth to an answer. I think oxen and wainropes

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: cannot hale them together. For Andrew, if he were

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: opened, and you find so much blood in his liver as

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: will clog the foot of a flea, I'll eat the rest of

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: the anatomy.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: And his opposite, the youth, bears in his visage no

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: great presage of cruelty.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Enter MARIA

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Look, where the youngest wren of nine comes.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: If you desire the spleen, and will laugh yourself

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: into stitches, follow me. Yond gull Malvolio is

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: turned heathen, a very renegado; for there is no

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Christian, that means to be saved by believing

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: rightly, can ever believe such impossible passages

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: of grossness. He's in yellow stockings.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: And cross-gartered?

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Most villanously; like a pedant that keeps a school

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: i' the church. I have dogged him, like his

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: murderer. He does obey every point of the letter

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: that I dropped to betray him: he does smile his

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: face into more lines than is in the new map with the

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: augmentation of the Indies: you have not seen such

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: a thing as 'tis. I can hardly forbear hurling things

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: at him. I know my lady will strike him: if she do,

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: he'll smile and take't for a great favour.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Come, bring us, bring us where he is.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: SCENE III. A street.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Enter SEBASTIAN and ANTONIO

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I would not by my will have troubled you;

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: But, since you make your pleasure of your pains,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I will no further chide you.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I could not stay behind you: my desire,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: More sharp than filed steel, did spur me forth;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: And not all love to see you, though so much

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: As might have drawn one to a longer voyage,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: But jealousy what might befall your travel,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Being skilless in these parts; which to a stranger,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Unguided and unfriended, often prove

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Rough and unhospitable: my willing love,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: The rather by these arguments of fear,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Set forth in your pursuit.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: My kind Antonio,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I can no other answer make but thanks,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: And thanks; and ever [         ] oft good turns

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Are shuffled off with such uncurrent pay:

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: But, were my worth as is my conscience firm,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: You should find better dealing. What's to do?

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Shall we go see the reliques of this town?

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: To-morrow, sir: best first go see your lodging.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I am not weary, and 'tis long to night:

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I pray you, let us satisfy our eyes

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: With the memorials and the things of fame

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: That do renown this city.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Would you'ld pardon me;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I do not without danger walk these streets:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Once, in a sea-fight, 'gainst the count his galleys

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I did some service; of such note indeed,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: That were I ta'en here it would scarce be answer'd.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Belike you slew great number of his people.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: The offence is not of such a bloody nature;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Albeit the quality of the time and quarrel

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Might well have given us bloody argument.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: It might have since been answer'd in repaying

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: What we took from them; which, for traffic's sake,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Most of our city did: only myself stood out;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: For which, if I be lapsed in this place,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I shall pay dear.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Do not then walk too open.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: It doth not fit me. Hold, sir, here's my purse.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: In the south suburbs, at the Elephant,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Is best to lodge: I will bespeak our diet,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Whiles you beguile the time and feed your knowledge

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: With viewing of the town: there shall you have me.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Why I your purse?

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Haply your eye shall light upon some toy

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: You have desire to purchase; and your store,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I think, is not for idle markets, sir.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I'll be your purse-bearer and leave you

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: For an hour.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: To the Elephant.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I do remember.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: SCENE IV. OLIVIA's garden.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Enter OLIVIA and MARIA

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I have sent after him: he says he'll come;

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: How shall I feast him? what bestow of him?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: For youth is bought more oft than begg'd or borrow'd.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I speak too loud.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Where is Malvolio? he is sad and civil,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: And suits well for a servant with my fortunes:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Where is Malvolio?

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: He's coming, madam; but in very strange manner. He

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: is, sure, possessed, madam.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Why, what's the matter? does he rave?

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: No. madam, he does nothing but smile: your

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: ladyship were best to have some guard about you, if

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: he come; for, sure, the man is tainted in's wits.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Go call him hither.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exit MARIA

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I am as mad as he,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: If sad and merry madness equal be.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Re-enter MARIA, with MALVOLIO

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: How now, Malvolio!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Sweet lady, ho, ho.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Smilest thou?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I sent for thee upon a sad occasion.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Sad, lady! I could be sad: this does make some

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: obstruction in the blood, this cross-gartering; but

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: what of that? if it please the eye of one, it is

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: with me as the very true sonnet is, 'Please one, and

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: please all.'

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Why, how dost thou, man? what is the matter with thee?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Not black in my mind, though yellow in my legs. It

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: did come to his hands, and commands shall be

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: executed: I think we do know the sweet Roman hand.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Wilt thou go to bed, Malvolio?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: To bed! ay, sweet-heart, and I'll come to thee.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: God comfort thee! Why dost thou smile so and kiss

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: thy hand so oft?

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: How do you, Malvolio?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: At your request! yes; nightingales answer daws.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Why appear you with this ridiculous boldness before my lady?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'Be not afraid of greatness:' 'twas well writ.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: What meanest thou by that, Malvolio?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'Some are born great,'--

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Ha!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'Some achieve greatness,'--

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: What sayest thou?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'And some have greatness thrust upon them.'

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Heaven restore thee!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'Remember who commended thy yellow stocking s,'--

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Thy yellow stockings!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'And wished to see thee cross-gartered.'

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Cross-gartered!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'Go to thou art made, if thou desirest to be so;'--

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Am I made?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'If not, let me see thee a servant still.'

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Why, this is very midsummer madness.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Enter Servant

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Madam, the young gentleman of the Count Orsino's is

speaker: Servant
text_entry: returned: I could hardly entreat him back: he

speaker: Servant
text_entry: attends your ladyship's pleasure.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I'll come to him.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Good Maria, let this fellow be looked to. Where's

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: my cousin Toby? Let some of my people have a special

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: care of him: I would not have him miscarry for the

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: half of my dowry.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exeunt OLIVIA and MARIA

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: O, ho! do you come near me now? no worse man than

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Sir Toby to look to me! This concurs directly with

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: the letter: she sends him on purpose, that I may

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: appear stubborn to him; for she incites me to that

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: in the letter. 'Cast thy humble slough,' says she;

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: 'be opposite with a kinsman, surly with servants;

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: let thy tongue tang with arguments of state; put

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: thyself into the trick of singularity;' and

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: consequently sets down the manner how; as, a sad

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: face, a reverend carriage, a slow tongue, in the

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: habit of some sir of note, and so forth. I have

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: limed her; but it is Jove's doing, and Jove make me

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: thankful! And when she went away now, 'Let this

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: fellow be looked to:' fellow! not Malvolio, nor

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: after my degree, but fellow. Why, every thing

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: adheres together, that no dram of a scruple, no

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: scruple of a scruple, no obstacle, no incredulous

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: or unsafe circumstance--What can be said? Nothing

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: that can be can come between me and the full

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: prospect of my hopes. Well, Jove, not I, is the

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: doer of this, and he is to be thanked.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Re-enter MARIA, with SIR TOBY BELCH and FABIAN

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Which way is he, in the name of sanctity? If all

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: the devils of hell be drawn in little, and Legion

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: himself possessed him, yet I'll speak to him.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Here he is, here he is. How is't with you, sir?

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: how is't with you, man?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Go off; I discard you: let me enjoy my private: go

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: off.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Lo, how hollow the fiend speaks within him! did not

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: I tell you? Sir Toby, my lady prays you to have a

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: care of him.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Ah, ha! does she so?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Go to, go to; peace, peace; we must deal gently

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: with him: let me alone. How do you, Malvolio? how

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: is't with you? What, man! defy the devil:

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: consider, he's an enemy to mankind.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Do you know what you say?

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: La you, an you speak ill of the devil, how he takes

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: it at heart! Pray God, he be not bewitched!

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Carry his water to the wise woman.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Marry, and it shall be done to-morrow morning, if I

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: live. My lady would not lose him for more than I'll say.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: How now, mistress!

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: O Lord!

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Prithee, hold thy peace; this is not the way: do

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: you not see you move him? let me alone with him.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: No way but gentleness; gently, gently: the fiend is

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: rough, and will not be roughly used.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Why, how now, my bawcock! how dost thou, chuck?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Sir!

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Ay, Biddy, come with me. What, man! 'tis not for

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: gravity to play at cherry-pit with Satan: hang

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: him, foul collier!

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Get him to say his prayers, good Sir Toby, get him to pray.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: My prayers, minx!

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: No, I warrant you, he will not hear of godliness.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Go, hang yourselves all! you are idle shallow

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: things: I am not of your element: you shall know

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: more hereafter.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Is't possible?

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: If this were played upon a stage now, I could

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: condemn it as an improbable fiction.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: His very genius hath taken the infection of the device, man.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Nay, pursue him now, lest the device take air and taint.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Why, we shall make him mad indeed.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: The house will be the quieter.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Come, we'll have him in a dark room and bound. My

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: niece is already in the belief that he's mad: we

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: may carry it thus, for our pleasure and his penance,

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: till our very pastime, tired out of breath, prompt

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: us to have mercy on him: at which time we will

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: bring the device to the bar and crown thee for a

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: finder of madmen. But see, but see.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Enter SIR ANDREW

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: More matter for a May morning.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Here's the challenge, read it: warrant there's

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: vinegar and pepper in't.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Is't so saucy?

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Ay, is't, I warrant him: do but read.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Give me.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Reads

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: 'Youth, whatsoever thou art, thou art but a scurvy fellow.'

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Good, and valiant.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: [Reads]  'Wonder not, nor admire not in thy mind,

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: why I do call thee so, for I will show thee no reason for't.'

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: A good note; that keeps you from the blow of the law.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: [Reads]  'Thou comest to the lady Olivia, and in my

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: sight she uses thee kindly: but thou liest in thy

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: throat; that is not the matter I challenge thee for.'

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Very brief, and to exceeding good sense--less.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: [Reads]  'I will waylay thee going home; where if it

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: be thy chance to kill me,'--

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Good.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: [Reads]  'Thou killest me like a rogue and a villain.'

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Still you keep o' the windy side of the law: good.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: [Reads]  'Fare thee well; and God have mercy upon

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: one of our souls! He may have mercy upon mine; but

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: my hope is better, and so look to thyself. Thy

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: friend, as thou usest him, and thy sworn enemy,

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: ANDREW AGUECHEEK.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: If this letter move him not, his legs cannot:

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: I'll give't him.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: You may have very fit occasion for't: he is now in

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: some commerce with my lady, and will by and by depart.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Go, Sir Andrew: scout me for him at the corner the

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: orchard like a bum-baily: so soon as ever thou seest

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: him, draw; and, as thou drawest swear horrible; for

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: it comes to pass oft that a terrible oath, with a

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: swaggering accent sharply twanged off, gives manhood

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: more approbation than ever proof itself would have

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: earned him. Away!

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Nay, let me alone for swearing.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Exit

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Now will not I deliver his letter: for the behavior

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: of the young gentleman gives him out to be of good

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: capacity and breeding; his employment between his

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: lord and my niece confirms no less: therefore this

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: letter, being so excellently ignorant, will breed no

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: terror in the youth: he will find it comes from a

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: clodpole. But, sir, I will deliver his challenge by

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: word of mouth; set upon Aguecheek a notable report

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: of valour; and drive the gentleman, as I know his

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: youth will aptly receive it, into a most hideous

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: opinion of his rage, skill, fury and impetuosity.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: This will so fright them both that they will kill

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: one another by the look, like cockatrices.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Re-enter OLIVIA, with VIOLA

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Here he comes with your niece: give them way till

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: he take leave, and presently after him.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: I will meditate the while upon some horrid message

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: for a challenge.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Exeunt SIR TOBY BELCH, FABIAN, and MARIA

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I have said too much unto a heart of stone

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: And laid mine honour too unchary out:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: There's something in me that reproves my fault;

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: But such a headstrong potent fault it is,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: That it but mocks reproof.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: With the same 'havior that your passion bears

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Goes on my master's grief.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Here, wear this jewel for me, 'tis my picture;

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Refuse it not; it hath no tongue to vex you;

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: And I beseech you come again to-morrow.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: What shall you ask of me that I'll deny,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: That honour saved may upon asking give?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Nothing but this; your true love for my master.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: How with mine honour may I give him that

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Which I have given to you?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I will acquit you.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Well, come again to-morrow: fare thee well:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: A fiend like thee might bear my soul to hell.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Re-enter SIR TOBY BELCH and FABIAN

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Gentleman, God save thee.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And you, sir.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: That defence thou hast, betake thee to't: of what

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: nature the wrongs are thou hast done him, I know

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: not; but thy intercepter, full of despite, bloody as

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: the hunter, attends thee at the orchard-end:

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: dismount thy tuck, be yare in thy preparation, for

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: thy assailant is quick, skilful and deadly.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: You mistake, sir; I am sure no man hath any quarrel

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: to me: my remembrance is very free and clear from

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: any image of offence done to any man.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: You'll find it otherwise, I assure you: therefore,

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: if you hold your life at any price, betake you to

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: your guard; for your opposite hath in him what

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: youth, strength, skill and wrath can furnish man withal.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I pray you, sir, what is he?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: He is knight, dubbed with unhatched rapier and on

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: carpet consideration; but he is a devil in private

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: brawl: souls and bodies hath he divorced three; and

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: his incensement at this moment is so implacable,

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: that satisfaction can be none but by pangs of death

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: and sepulchre. Hob, nob, is his word; give't or take't.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I will return again into the house and desire some

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: conduct of the lady. I am no fighter. I have heard

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: of some kind of men that put quarrels purposely on

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: others, to taste their valour: belike this is a man

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: of that quirk.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Sir, no; his indignation derives itself out of a

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: very competent injury: therefore, get you on and

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: give him his desire. Back you shall not to the

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: house, unless you undertake that with me which with

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: as much safety you might answer him: therefore, on,

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: or strip your sword stark naked; for meddle you

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: must, that's certain, or forswear to wear iron about you.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: This is as uncivil as strange. I beseech you, do me

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: this courteous office, as to know of the knight what

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: my offence to him is: it is something of my

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: negligence, nothing of my purpose.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: I will do so. Signior Fabian, stay you by this

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: gentleman till my return.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Exit

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Pray you, sir, do you know of this matter?

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: I know the knight is incensed against you, even to a

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: mortal arbitrement; but nothing of the circumstance more.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I beseech you, what manner of man is he?

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Nothing of that wonderful promise, to read him by

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: his form, as you are like to find him in the proof

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: of his valour. He is, indeed, sir, the most skilful,

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: bloody and fatal opposite that you could possibly

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: have found in any part of Illyria. Will you walk

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: towards him? I will make your peace with him if I

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: can.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I shall be much bound to you for't: I am one that

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: had rather go with sir priest than sir knight: I

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: care not who knows so much of my mettle.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Re-enter SIR TOBY BELCH, with SIR ANDREW

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Why, man, he's a very devil; I have not seen such a

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: firago. I had a pass with him, rapier, scabbard and

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: all, and he gives me the stuck in with such a mortal

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: motion, that it is inevitable; and on the answer, he

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: pays you as surely as your feet hit the ground they

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: step on. They say he has been fencer to the Sophy.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Pox on't, I'll not meddle with him.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Ay, but he will not now be pacified: Fabian can

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: scarce hold him yonder.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Plague on't, an I thought he had been valiant and so

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: cunning in fence, I'ld have seen him damned ere I'ld

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: have challenged him. Let him let the matter slip,

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: and I'll give him my horse, grey Capilet.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: I'll make the motion: stand here, make a good show

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: on't: this shall end without the perdition of souls.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Aside

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Marry, I'll ride your horse as well as I ride you.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Re-enter FABIAN and VIOLA

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: To FABIAN

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: I have his horse to take up the quarrel:

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: I have persuaded him the youth's a devil.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: He is as horribly conceited of him; and pants and

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: looks pale, as if a bear were at his heels.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: [To VIOLA]  There's no remedy, sir; he will fight

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: with you for's oath sake: marry, he hath better

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: bethought him of his quarrel, and he finds that now

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: scarce to be worth talking of: therefore draw, for

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: the supportance of his vow; he protests he will not hurt you.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: [Aside]  Pray God defend me! A little thing would

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: make me tell them how much I lack of a man.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Give ground, if you see him furious.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Come, Sir Andrew, there's no remedy; the gentleman

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: will, for his honour's sake, have one bout with you;

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: he cannot by the duello avoid it: but he has

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: promised me, as he is a gentleman and a soldier, he

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: will not hurt you. Come on; to't.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Pray God, he keep his oath!

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I do assure you, 'tis against my will.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: They draw

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Enter ANTONIO

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Put up your sword. If this young gentleman

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Have done offence, I take the fault on me:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: If you offend him, I for him defy you.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: You, sir! why, what are you?

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: One, sir, that for his love dares yet do more

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Than you have heard him brag to you he will.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Nay, if you be an undertaker, I am for you.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: They draw

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Enter Officers

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: O good Sir Toby, hold! here come the officers.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: I'll be with you anon.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Pray, sir, put your sword up, if you please.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Marry, will I, sir; and, for that I promised you,

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: I'll be as good as my word: he will bear you easily

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: and reins well.

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: This is the man; do thy office.

speaker: Second Officer
text_entry: Antonio, I arrest thee at the suit of Count Orsino.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: You do mistake me, sir.

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: No, sir, no jot; I know your favour well,

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: Though now you have no sea-cap on your head.

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: Take him away: he knows I know him well.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I must obey.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: To VIOLA

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: This comes with seeking you:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: But there's no remedy; I shall answer it.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: What will you do, now my necessity

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Makes me to ask you for my purse? It grieves me

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Much more for what I cannot do for you

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Than what befalls myself. You stand amazed;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: But be of comfort.

speaker: Second Officer
text_entry: Come, sir, away.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I must entreat of you some of that money.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: What money, sir?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: For the fair kindness you have show'd me here,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And, part, being prompted by your present trouble,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Out of my lean and low ability

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I'll lend you something: my having is not much;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I'll make division of my present with you:

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Hold, there's half my coffer.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Will you deny me now?

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Is't possible that my deserts to you

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Can lack persuasion? Do not tempt my misery,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Lest that it make me so unsound a man

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: As to upbraid you with those kindnesses

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: That I have done for you.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I know of none;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Nor know I you by voice or any feature:

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I hate ingratitude more in a man

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Than lying, vainness, babbling, drunkenness,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Or any taint of vice whose strong corruption

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Inhabits our frail blood.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: O heavens themselves!

speaker: Second Officer
text_entry: Come, sir, I pray you, go.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Let me speak a little. This youth that you see here

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: I snatch'd one half out of the jaws of death,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Relieved him with such sanctity of love,

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: And to his image, which methought did promise

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Most venerable worth, did I devotion.

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: What's that to us? The time goes by: away!

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: But O how vile an idol proves this god

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Thou hast, Sebastian, done good feature shame.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: In nature there's no blemish but the mind;

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: None can be call'd deform'd but the unkind:

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Virtue is beauty, but the beauteous evil

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Are empty trunks o'erflourish'd by the devil.

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: The man grows mad: away with him! Come, come, sir.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Lead me on.

speaker: ANTONIO
text_entry: Exit with Officers

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Methinks his words do from such passion fly,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: That he believes himself: so do not I.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Prove true, imagination, O, prove true,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: That I, dear brother, be now ta'en for you!

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Come hither, knight; come hither, Fabian: we'll

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: whisper o'er a couplet or two of most sage saws.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: He named Sebastian: I my brother know

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Yet living in my glass; even such and so

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: In favour was my brother, and he went

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Still in this fashion, colour, ornament,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: For him I imitate: O, if it prove,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Tempests are kind and salt waves fresh in love.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: A very dishonest paltry boy, and more a coward than

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: a hare: his dishonesty appears in leaving his

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: friend here in necessity and denying him; and for

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: his cowardship, ask Fabian.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: A coward, a most devout coward, religious in it.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: 'Slid, I'll after him again and beat him.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Do; cuff him soundly, but never draw thy sword.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: An I do not,--

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Come, let's see the event.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: I dare lay any money 'twill be nothing yet.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: ACT IV

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: SCENE I. Before OLIVIA's house.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Enter SEBASTIAN and Clown

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Will you make me believe that I am not sent for you?

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Go to, go to, thou art a foolish fellow:

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Let me be clear of thee.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Well held out, i' faith! No, I do not know you; nor

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I am not sent to you by my lady, to bid you come

speaker: Clown
text_entry: speak with her; nor your name is not Master Cesario;

speaker: Clown
text_entry: nor this is not my nose neither. Nothing that is so is so.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I prithee, vent thy folly somewhere else: Thou

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: know'st not me.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Vent my folly! he has heard that word of some

speaker: Clown
text_entry: great man and now applies it to a fool. Vent my

speaker: Clown
text_entry: folly! I am afraid this great lubber, the world,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: will prove a cockney. I prithee now, ungird thy

speaker: Clown
text_entry: strangeness and tell me what I shall vent to my

speaker: Clown
text_entry: lady: shall I vent to her that thou art coming?

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I prithee, foolish Greek, depart from me: There's

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: money for thee: if you tarry longer, I shall give

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: worse payment.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: By my troth, thou hast an open hand. These wise men

speaker: Clown
text_entry: that give fools money get themselves a good

speaker: Clown
text_entry: report--after fourteen years' purchase.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Enter SIR ANDREW, SIR TOBY BELCH, and FABIAN

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Now, sir, have I met you again? there's for you.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Why, there's for thee, and there, and there. Are all

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: the people mad?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Hold, sir, or I'll throw your dagger o'er the house.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: This will I tell my lady straight: I would not be

speaker: Clown
text_entry: in some of your coats for two pence.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Exit

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Come on, sir; hold.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Nay, let him alone: I'll go another way to work

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: with him; I'll have an action of battery against

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: him, if there be any law in Illyria: though I

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: struck him first, yet it's no matter for that.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Let go thy hand.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Come, sir, I will not let you go. Come, my young

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: soldier, put up your iron: you are well fleshed; come on.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I will be free from thee. What wouldst thou now? If

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: thou darest tempt me further, draw thy sword.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: What, what? Nay, then I must have an ounce or two

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: of this malapert blood from you.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Enter OLIVIA

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Hold, Toby; on thy life I charge thee, hold!

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Madam!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Will it be ever thus? Ungracious wretch,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Fit for the mountains and the barbarous caves,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Where manners ne'er were preach'd! out of my sight!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Be not offended, dear Cesario.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Rudesby, be gone!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exeunt SIR TOBY BELCH, SIR ANDREW, and FABIAN

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I prithee, gentle friend,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Let thy fair wisdom, not thy passion, sway

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: In this uncivil and thou unjust extent

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Against thy peace. Go with me to my house,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: And hear thou there how many fruitless pranks

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: This ruffian hath botch'd up, that thou thereby

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Mayst smile at this: thou shalt not choose but go:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Do not deny. Beshrew his soul for me,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: He started one poor heart of mine in thee.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: What relish is in this? how runs the stream?

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Or I am mad, or else this is a dream:

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Let fancy still my sense in Lethe steep;

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: If it be thus to dream, still let me sleep!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Nay, come, I prithee; would thou'ldst be ruled by me!

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Madam, I will.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: O, say so, and so be!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: SCENE II. OLIVIA's house.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Enter MARIA and Clown

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Nay, I prithee, put on this gown and this beard;

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: make him believe thou art Sir Topas the curate: do

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: it quickly; I'll call Sir Toby the whilst.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Well, I'll put it on, and I will dissemble myself

speaker: Clown
text_entry: in't; and I would I were the first that ever

speaker: Clown
text_entry: dissembled in such a gown. I am not tall enough to

speaker: Clown
text_entry: become the function well, nor lean enough to be

speaker: Clown
text_entry: thought a good student; but to be said an honest man

speaker: Clown
text_entry: and a good housekeeper goes as fairly as to say a

speaker: Clown
text_entry: careful man and a great scholar. The competitors enter.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Enter SIR TOBY BELCH and MARIA

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Jove bless thee, master Parson.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Bonos dies, Sir Toby: for, as the old hermit of

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Prague, that never saw pen and ink, very wittily

speaker: Clown
text_entry: said to a niece of King Gorboduc, 'That that is is;'

speaker: Clown
text_entry: so I, being Master Parson, am Master Parson; for,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: what is 'that' but 'that,' and 'is' but 'is'?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: To him, Sir Topas.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: What, ho, I say! peace in this prison!

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: The knave counterfeits well; a good knave.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: [Within]  Who calls there?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Sir Topas the curate, who comes to visit Malvolio

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the lunatic.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Sir Topas, Sir Topas, good Sir Topas, go to my lady.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Out, hyperbolical fiend! how vexest thou this man!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: talkest thou nothing but of ladies?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Well said, Master Parson.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Sir Topas, never was man thus wronged: good Sir

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Topas, do not think I am mad: they have laid me

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: here in hideous darkness.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Fie, thou dishonest Satan! I call thee by the most

speaker: Clown
text_entry: modest terms; for I am one of those gentle ones

speaker: Clown
text_entry: that will use the devil himself with courtesy:

speaker: Clown
text_entry: sayest thou that house is dark?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: As hell, Sir Topas.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Why it hath bay windows transparent as barricadoes,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: and the clearstores toward the south north are as

speaker: Clown
text_entry: lustrous as ebony; and yet complainest thou of

speaker: Clown
text_entry: obstruction?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: I am not mad, Sir Topas: I say to you, this house is dark.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Madman, thou errest: I say, there is no darkness

speaker: Clown
text_entry: but ignorance; in which thou art more puzzled than

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the Egyptians in their fog.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: I say, this house is as dark as ignorance, though

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: ignorance were as dark as hell; and I say, there

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: was never man thus abused. I am no more mad than you

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: are: make the trial of it in any constant question.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: What is the opinion of Pythagoras concerning wild fowl?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: That the soul of our grandam might haply inhabit a bird.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: What thinkest thou of his opinion?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: I think nobly of the soul, and no way approve his opinion.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Fare thee well. Remain thou still in darkness:

speaker: Clown
text_entry: thou shalt hold the opinion of Pythagoras ere I will

speaker: Clown
text_entry: allow of thy wits, and fear to kill a woodcock, lest

speaker: Clown
text_entry: thou dispossess the soul of thy grandam. Fare thee well.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Sir Topas, Sir Topas!

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: My most exquisite Sir Topas!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Nay, I am for all waters.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Thou mightst have done this without thy beard and

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: gown: he sees thee not.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: To him in thine own voice, and bring me word how

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: thou findest him: I would we were well rid of this

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: knavery. If he may be conveniently delivered, I

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: would he were, for I am now so far in offence with

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: my niece that I cannot pursue with any safety this

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: sport to the upshot. Come by and by to my chamber.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Exeunt SIR TOBY BELCH and MARIA

speaker: Clown
text_entry: [Singing]

speaker: Clown
text_entry: 'Hey, Robin, jolly Robin,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Tell me how thy lady does.'

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Fool!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: 'My lady is unkind, perdy.'

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Fool!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: 'Alas, why is she so?'

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Fool, I say!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: 'She loves another'--Who calls, ha?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Good fool, as ever thou wilt deserve well at my

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: hand, help me to a candle, and pen, ink and paper:

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: as I am a gentleman, I will live to be thankful to

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: thee for't.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Master Malvolio?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Ay, good fool.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Alas, sir, how fell you besides your five wits?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Fool, there was never a man so notoriously abused: I

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: am as well in my wits, fool, as thou art.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: But as well? then you are mad indeed, if you be no

speaker: Clown
text_entry: better in your wits than a fool.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: They have here propertied me; keep me in darkness,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: send ministers to me, asses, and do all they can to

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: face me out of my wits.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Advise you what you say; the minister is here.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Malvolio, Malvolio, thy wits the heavens restore!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: endeavour thyself to sleep, and leave thy vain

speaker: Clown
text_entry: bibble babble.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Sir Topas!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Maintain no words with him, good fellow. Who, I,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: sir? not I, sir. God be wi' you, good Sir Topas.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Merry, amen. I will, sir, I will.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Fool, fool, fool, I say!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Alas, sir, be patient. What say you sir? I am

speaker: Clown
text_entry: shent for speaking to you.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Good fool, help me to some light and some paper: I

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: tell thee, I am as well in my wits as any man in Illyria.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Well-a-day that you were, sir

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: By this hand, I am. Good fool, some ink, paper and

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: light; and convey what I will set down to my lady:

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: it shall advantage thee more than ever the bearing

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: of letter did.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I will help you to't. But tell me true, are you

speaker: Clown
text_entry: not mad indeed? or do you but counterfeit?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Believe me, I am not; I tell thee true.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Nay, I'll ne'er believe a madman till I see his

speaker: Clown
text_entry: brains. I will fetch you light and paper and ink.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Fool, I'll requite it in the highest degree: I

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: prithee, be gone.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: [Singing]

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I am gone, sir,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: And anon, sir,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I'll be with you again,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: In a trice,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Like to the old Vice,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Your need to sustain;

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Who, with dagger of lath,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: In his rage and his wrath,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Cries, ah, ha! to the devil:

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Like a mad lad,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Pare thy nails, dad;

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Adieu, good man devil.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Exit

speaker: Clown
text_entry: SCENE III. OLIVIA's garden.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Enter SEBASTIAN

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: This is the air; that is the glorious sun;

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: This pearl she gave me, I do feel't and see't;

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: And though 'tis wonder that enwraps me thus,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Yet 'tis not madness. Where's Antonio, then?

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I could not find him at the Elephant:

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Yet there he was; and there I found this credit,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: That he did range the town to seek me out.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: His counsel now might do me golden service;

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: For though my soul disputes well with my sense,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: That this may be some error, but no madness,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Yet doth this accident and flood of fortune

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: So far exceed all instance, all discourse,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: That I am ready to distrust mine eyes

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: And wrangle with my reason that persuades me

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: To any other trust but that I am mad

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Or else the lady's mad; yet, if 'twere so,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: She could not sway her house, command her followers,

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Take and give back affairs and their dispatch

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: With such a smooth, discreet and stable bearing

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: As I perceive she does: there's something in't

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: That is deceiveable. But here the lady comes.

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: Enter OLIVIA and Priest

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Blame not this haste of mine. If you mean well,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Now go with me and with this holy man

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Into the chantry by: there, before him,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: And underneath that consecrated roof,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Plight me the full assurance of your faith;

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: That my most jealous and too doubtful soul

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: May live at peace. He shall conceal it

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Whiles you are willing it shall come to note,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: What time we will our celebration keep

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: According to my birth. What do you say?

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: I'll follow this good man, and go with you;

speaker: SEBASTIAN
text_entry: And, having sworn truth, ever will be true.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Then lead the way, good father; and heavens so shine,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: That they may fairly note this act of mine!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: SCENE I. Before OLIVIA's house.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Enter Clown and FABIAN

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Now, as thou lovest me, let me see his letter.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Good Master Fabian, grant me another request.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Any thing.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Do not desire to see this letter.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: This is, to give a dog, and in recompense desire my

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: dog again.

speaker: FABIAN
text_entry: Enter DUKE ORSINO, VIOLA, CURIO, and Lords

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Belong you to the Lady Olivia, friends?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Ay, sir; we are some of her trappings.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: I know thee well; how dost thou, my good fellow?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Truly, sir, the better for my foes and the worse

speaker: Clown
text_entry: for my friends.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Just the contrary; the better for thy friends.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: No, sir, the worse.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: How can that be?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Marry, sir, they praise me and make an ass of me;

speaker: Clown
text_entry: now my foes tell me plainly I am an ass: so that by

speaker: Clown
text_entry: my foes, sir I profit in the knowledge of myself,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: and by my friends, I am abused: so that,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: conclusions to be as kisses, if your four negatives

speaker: Clown
text_entry: make your two affirmatives why then, the worse for

speaker: Clown
text_entry: my friends and the better for my foes.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Why, this is excellent.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: By my troth, sir, no; though it please you to be

speaker: Clown
text_entry: one of my friends.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Thou shalt not be the worse for me: there's gold.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: But that it would be double-dealing, sir, I would

speaker: Clown
text_entry: you could make it another.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: O, you give me ill counsel.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Put your grace in your pocket, sir, for this once,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: and let your flesh and blood obey it.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Well, I will be so much a sinner, to be a

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: double-dealer: there's another.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Primo, secundo, tertio, is a good play; and the old

speaker: Clown
text_entry: saying is, the third pays for all: the triplex,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: sir, is a good tripping measure; or the bells of

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Saint Bennet, sir, may put you in mind; one, two, three.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: You can fool no more money out of me at this throw:

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: if you will let your lady know I am here to speak

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: with her, and bring her along with you, it may awake

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: my bounty further.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Marry, sir, lullaby to your bounty till I come

speaker: Clown
text_entry: again. I go, sir; but I would not have you to think

speaker: Clown
text_entry: that my desire of having is the sin of covetousness:

speaker: Clown
text_entry: but, as you say, sir, let your bounty take a nap, I

speaker: Clown
text_entry: will awake it anon.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Exit

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Here comes the man, sir, that did rescue me.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Enter ANTONIO and Officers

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: That face of his I do remember well;

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Yet, when I saw it last, it was besmear'd

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: As black as Vulcan in the smoke of war:

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: A bawbling vessel was he captain of,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: For shallow draught and bulk unprizable;

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: With which such scathful grapple did he make

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: With the most noble bottom of our fleet,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: That very envy and the tongue of loss

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Cried fame and honour on him. What's the matter?

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: Orsino, this is that Antonio

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: That took the Phoenix and her fraught from Candy;

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: And this is he that did the Tiger board,

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: When your young nephew Titus lost his leg:

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: Here in the streets, desperate of shame and state,

speaker: First Officer
text_entry: In private brabble did we apprehend him.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: He did me kindness, sir, drew on my side;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: But in conclusion put strange speech upon me:

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I know not what 'twas but distraction.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Notable pirate! thou salt-water thief!

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: What foolish boldness brought thee to their mercies,

text_entry: and thus the whirligig of time brings in his revenges.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: I'll be revenged on the whole pack of you.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: He hath been most notoriously abused.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Pursue him and entreat him to a peace:

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: He hath not told us of the captain yet:

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: When that is known and golden time convents,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: A solemn combination shall be made

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Of our dear souls. Meantime, sweet sister,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: We will not part from hence. Cesario, come;

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: For so you shall be, while you are a man;

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: But when in other habits you are seen,

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Orsino's mistress and his fancy's queen.

speaker: DUKE ORSINO
text_entry: Exeunt all, except Clown

speaker: Clown
text_entry: [Sings]

speaker: Clown
text_entry: When that I was and a little tiny boy,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: With hey, ho, the wind and the rain,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: A foolish thing was but a toy,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: For the rain it raineth every day.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: But when I came to man's estate,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: With hey, ho,  and c.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: 'Gainst knaves and thieves men shut their gate,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: For the rain,  and c.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: But when I came, alas! to wive,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: With hey, ho,  and c.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: By swaggering could I never thrive,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: For the rain,  and c.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: But when I came unto my beds,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: With hey, ho,  and c.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: With toss-pots still had drunken heads,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: For the rain,  and c.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: A great while ago the world begun,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: With hey, ho,  and c.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: But that's all one, our play is done,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: And we'll strive to please you every day.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Exit
